definition[0]: the past tense and past participle of find
definition[1]: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money
example[0]: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
example[1]: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
definition[2]: to melt metal and pour it into a mould (=a hollow shape), to make things such as tools and parts for machines
definition[3]: to start a new company or organization
example[2]: The company was founded back in 1947.
